Enviro HP1200 + 700X
Relevant Australian Standards Checked
Specification / Standard: AS4654.1-2012; AS3740 - 2010, Manufacturer’s Technical Data Sheet

Check substrate. The surface must be clean, dry and free from all loose particles including dust, laitance, grease, coatings, curing compounds and any other foreign matter. Check critical areas (puddle flanges, penetrations, expansion joints, rebates/setdowns)
Attach Photo

Substrate Preparation and Caulking. Prepare surface to accept primer using a scraper or grinder and vacuum or sweep residual debris. Remove all sharp edges including screws, nails and concrete/mortar projections. Apply a suitable and approved joint sealant such as Enviro Flex Pro or Enviro Flex FC to all joints and connecting building parts prior to  the  application  of  Enviro 700X
Attach Photo
Priming. Apply primer (Enviro Epoxy B-LV / Enviro Prime P2 / Enviro Shield) using a brush or roller. Allow  primer  to  fully  cure  before  proceeding  with  the application of Enviro 700X
Attach Photo

Mixing and Application. HP1200 should be thoroughly mixed with a mechanical mixer at low speed (less than 400 RPM) prior to application. Apply Enviro 700X using brush/roller achieving 1.6mm WFT / 1.5mm DFT. (2 coats)
Attach Photo
Curing. Allow product to cure for 12 hours before recoating. Care should be taken when walking over newly installed Enviro 700X to ensure the membrane is not damaged

Top Coat. Enviro 700X should be thoroughly mixed using a mechanical mixer at low speed prior to application.Add Part B to Part A and mix to a uniform colour and consistency for a minimum of 3 minutes. Allow to react for 10 minutes before application. Allow to react for 15 minutes when thinning with Enviro Thinner No.8 before application. Do not apply in damp or wet conditions. Allow each coat to sufficiently dry before proceeding to the next coat
Attach Photo
Testing. Carry out Spark Testing and adhesion tests. Repair pinholes and imperfections. Areas marked indicate location of Test
Attach Photo
Final signoff and handover. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured. Check for any pinholes and bubbles. Sign-off from builder and hand-over
HOLD POINT - CLICK HERE TO REQUEST BUILDER SIGN OFF

Item no. 1 Material delivery & unloading
Hazard and Risk : Manual handling injuries, Spills, Moving plant
Use of lift for vertical delivery of materials & equipment
Use proper lifting techniques. Code of practice for manual handling
Use of trolleys for horizontal delivery of materials.
Drums to be secured.
Use absorbent (soil sand, vermiculite or other inert material) to collect and seal in properly labelled containers for disposal
Make sure pathways are clear and free of loose materials
Be aware of surroundings and moving plants.
High visibility vest, safety boots, long sleeve shirts and pants to be worn at all times.
Be aware of other workers.
HOLD POINT - CLICK HERE TO REQUEST POLYSEAL EMPLOYEE SIGN OFF
Item no. 2 Transport/Carry materials to workface or storage
Hazard and Risk : Manual handling injuries, Slips, Roof Access, Working at Height
Limit manual lifting weight to 20kgs.
Use of lift for vertical delivery of materials & equipment
Use proper lifting techniques. Code of practice for manual handling.
Use of trolleys for horizontal delivery of materials
Drums to be secured.
Make sure pathways are clear and free of loose materials
Be aware of surroundings and moving plants.
All personnel provided with appropriate PPE : masks, hard hats, safety boots, high vis vest, safety glasses, gloves, long sleeve shirts and pants
Be aware of other workers.
Roof access permit required prior to accessing roof, working at heights certificate and harness/fall restraint to be worn if working within 3m of a live edge.
Roof access hatch to be closed and locked when operatives no longer working on the roof (end of day or during breaks)
HOLD POINT - CLICK HERE TO REQUEST POLYSEAL EMPLOYEE SIGN OFF
Item no. 3 Safe storage of chemicals in agreed designated area approved by the builder
Hazard and Risk : Spillage, Exposure
Drums to be secured. Use absorbent  soil sand, vermiculite or other inert material to collect and seal in properly labeled containers for disposal.
All personnel provided with appropriate PPE : masks, hard hats, safety boots, high vis vest, safety glasses, gloves, long sleeve shirts and pants
All employees in house and supplier trained in MSDS requirements (refer to MSDS for appropriate handling of product). All storage to be in line with SDS attached
HOLD POINT - CLICK HERE TO REQUEST POLYSEAL EMPLOYEE SIGN OFF
Item no. 4 Floor grinding to prepare surface to be membraned / coated
Hazard and Risk : Manual handling injuries. Contact with faulty electrical equipment. Running over obstacles and debris.
Prior to using tools, ensure Polyseal risk assessment is completed with FM for the use of electrical leads and non battery tools. Ensure that person operating the machinery is suitably qualified.
Ensure permits for floor grinding are obtained and current for duration of the work.
Ensure a p2 filter mask is worn during the grinding works to prevent inhalation of silica dust
Ensure vacuum extraction with HEPA filter is in use and all fittings are adequate
Check leads and connections daily.
Set up exclusion zones where work is to be undertaken.
Ensure Polyseal provides provisions (e.g. tape off area) to prevent access from any other trades.
All personnel provided with appropriate PPE: masks, hard hats, safety boots, high vis vest, safety glasses, gloves, long sleeve shirts, pants and ear protection.
Ensure hand grinder is currently tagged and frequently inspected & service monthly / serviced by licensed electrician. Check leads and connections daily.
Ensure experienced operators use the machines as per personnel competency & training.
Dust to be placed in plastic bags and secured and placed in bins provided.
HOLD POINT - CLICK HERE TO REQUEST POLYSEAL EMPLOYEE SIGN OFF
Item no. 5 Barricade work areas and clean work area and apply primer with brush or roller
Hazard and Risk : Dust, Inhalation/Health Risk
All personnel provided with appropriate PPE:  Respirators, hard hats, safety boots, high vis vest, safety glasses, gloves, long sleeve shirts, pants and ear protection.
Provide fire extinguisher - refer MSDS for spillage etc.
Make sure pathways are clear and free of loose materials.
Set-up barricades and/or signage where and if required.
HOLD POINT - CLICK HERE TO REQUEST POLYSEAL EMPLOYEE SIGN OFF
Item no. 6 Apply membranes:

Hazard and Risk : Contact with chemicals- exposure, skin contact, eye contact, dust and burns
Manual handling injuries with lifting pails
Using hazardous substances and flammable chemicals e.g. (xylene, toluene).
Ignition of chemicals and fire come into contact with body.
Using faulty electrical equipment.
Protection of existing surface finishes
Working around peno’s , slab edges, voids.
Risk of fall
All personnel provided with appropriate PPE : respirators, hard hats, safety boots, high vis vest, safety glasses, gloves, long sleeve shirts, pants and ear protection.
All employees in house and supplier trained in MSDS requirements  (Refer to product MSDS for appropriate handling of product).
All leads to be suspended off the ground.
Tools and leads inspected and tagged by licensed electrician on a monthly basis.Trained and qualified personnel use machine refer skills and competencies register.
Proper lifting and handling techniques to be adopted.
Barricade & exclusion zone to work areas  including signage.
Ensure work area is clear & safe to work in.
Ensure all staff have been inducted & read, signed SWMS, MSDS, and Hazards Register for new products to be used. Follow recommended controls stated in SDS attached
Spill kits to be used on site at all times.
No smoking in work area. Ensuring that any sources of ignition are kept away from area.
Appropriate warning signs displayed around perimeter of work.
Ensure that person operating the machinery is suitably qualified.
Ensure electrical equipment is inspected/tagged and checked regularly.
Advise builder should anything not be barricaded or closed up.
HOLD POINT - CLICK HERE TO REQUEST POLYSEAL EMPLOYEE SIGN OFF
Item no. 7 Rubbish disposal
Hazard and Risk : Environmental problem, Contamination
Daily clean of work site and storage areas
Removal of debris to designated areas/bins etc.
Polyseal to remove empty drums from the workplace  and place in bins provided by builder

Curing. Allow product to cure for 12 hours before recoating. Care should be taken when walking over newly installed Enviro 700X to ensure the membrane is not damaged.

Top Coat. Enviro 800 TC should be thoroughly mixed using a mechanical
mixer at low speed prior to application.Add Part B to Part A and mix to a uniform colour and consistency for a minimum of 3 minutes. Allow to react for 10 minutes before application. Allow to react for 15 minutes when thinning with Enviro Thinner No.8 before application. Do not apply in damp or wet conditions. Allow each coat to sufficiently dry before proceeding to the next coat.
Attach Photo
Testing. Carry out Spark Testing and adhesion tests. Repair pinholes and imperfections. Areas marked indicate location of Test.
Attach Photo
Final signoff and handover. Visually inspect and ensure adequately cured. Check for any pinholes and bubbles. Sign-off from builder and hand-over

Pre-Inspection Checklist
General Area
Has the builder provided a marked up plan on each area to be waterproofed?
Marked up plan has to be numbered if more than one area at a time is to be completed
Has the concrete been cured for 28 days, date of pour to be provided?
Has concrete moisture test been carried out and the result was provided for the locations on a marked up plan?
The moisture level should be around 7%
Is the concrete finished to an acceptable steel trowel class finish?
Have all tape, steel wire, nails, plywood or formwork, bracing, dyna bolt and/or steel brackets been removed and patched?
Is there any cracking in the substrate? If yes, an engineer’s report will need to be provided or the builder must sign off prior to commencement of works
Has any chemicals been used in the concrete process that may affect the membrane adhesion?

Puddle flanges used or installed must be recessed flush to the top of the concrete surface
Builder to check correct falls to drains
Patching to be completed 3 days prior to waterproofing proposed start date and/or second inspection required
Adequate spacing to seal around each one for Cast in items (conduit, water pipes etc).  No flexible conduits permitted
Would recommend using Enviro mortar 45 for all pin holes, overfilled then stoned back when dry

Document Upload Checklist
Documents attached below - details entered in comments
Enviro 700X + 250NS
Specification / Standard Manufacturer's Technical Data Sheet / AS4654.1 - 2012
Batch Number
Record batch number
Substrate crack and falls inspection

Obtain clearance for work to commence. Clean substrate so that is free of mould, paint, sealers, coatings, curing agents, loose particles, and other contamination or foreign matter that may interfere with the adhesion. for non metal surfaces: ICRI CSP-4 to CSP-6 for metal surfaces: ICRI CSP-1 to CSP-2.
Substrate crack and falls inspection

Fill cracks less than 1.6mm with filler compatible (Enviro-Flex Pro) with the membrane system.Live cracks to be referred to engineers for treatment methodology. Builder to approve falls on substrate(Min 1:100) prior to application of membrane.
Moisture Content
Note. min. 3 tests per 15m2 Enviro Epoxy B-LV up to 6.9% Enviro Prime P2 up to 5%
Hold Point (Mandatory) - work not to proceed without approval
Ambient temperature and RH
Reading twice a day- every 4 hours Mirvac to confirm temperature between the ranges of 5-35 degrees celsius prior to application of membrane. RH must be greater than 50%
Hold Point (Mandatory) - work not to proceed without approval
Mechanical Mixing
If applying Enviro Epoxy B-LV: Mix Part B, liquid hardener, to the Enviro Epoxy B-LV Part A base. Thoroughly mix with a mechanical mixer at low speed for not less than 5 minutes and until uniform.
Applying primer

Using a brush or roller apply the chosen primer. Allow to cure prior to over coating with sealants and/or membrane coats."Primer should be dry to touch and not be tacky when applying pressure to it. Enviro-Epoxy B-LV will take around 16-48 hrs @ 25 degrees C to dry (but could be longer depending on ambient temp and RH)
Seal/apply bondbreaker at junctions hob/floor
Apply Enviro Flex Pro to form smooth 15mm flexible cove to all internal corners, penetrations and joints.
Application of Enviro-700X

Mix Bucket at low speed( 400RPM) until thoroughly mixed. Apply two coats of 700X. Where membrane is terminated on a building element: Ensure that the termination height of the membrane above the FFL and/or invert level of a correctly placed overflow/spitter satisfies the Façade engineer's advice
QA Testing

Inspect after installation of reinforcement/finishes to check for any damage to waterproofing and rectify as required. Thickness testing of application to the recommended DFT of 1.5mm to manufacturers instructions. 5 tests per 15m2 Holiday/ spark testing of area.
Hold Point (Mandatory) - work not to proceed without approval
Application of 250N-S Top Coat

Mix Bucket at low speed( 400RPM) until thoroughly mixed. Apply 1 coats of 250N-S Where membrane is terminated on a building element: Ensure that the termination height of the membrane above the FFL and/or invert level of a correctly placed overflow/spitter satisfies the Façade engineer's advice
Protection of membrane edge

Ensure vertical terminations of membranes on a building element are provided with a pressure seal, reglet or by being overcoated with a waterproof or water resistant material to protect the membrane edge. Ensure vertical membrane termination junctions are caulked with Enviro FC pro.
Completion of Work Element
